byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, and Boryana Dzhambazova from Sofia, Bulgaria.
byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and BORYANA DZHAMBAZOVA

abstract: Bulgarian diplomat Kristalina Georgieva formally enters race to be next United Nations secretary general; Georgieva is vice president of European Commission and former official at World Bank; her entry complicates race to replace Ban Ki-moon, which already has twelve candidates.
lead_paragraph: The addition of a second Bulgarian candidate, Kristalina Georgieva, could alter the calculus between the West and Russia over who replaces Ban Ki-moon as secretary general.
snippet: The addition of a second Bulgarian candidate, Kristalina Georgieva, could alter the calculus between the West and Russia over who replaces Ban Ki-moon as secretary general....

headline.main: Bulgarian Shakes Up Race for U.N. Leader
headline.print_headline: A Bulgarian Shakes Up  the Race for U.N. Leader
